hu.akarnokd.reactive4java.base

Class Lambdas

  • java.lang.Object
    • hu.akarnokd.reactive4java.base.Lambdas

  • public final class Lambdas
extends Object
    Utility class to create functions which have their body as Javascript (or other script) language.

    Note that scripting performance is typically 10-100 slower than the same JIT compiled Java expression.

    See the scripting articles about how to script in java.

    Note that a script engines might not be thread safe, e.g., you might not run multiple scripts without external synchronization. See also THREADING for furhter details.

    Author:
    akarnokd, 2011.02.19.

    • Method Detail

      • action0

        @Nonnull
public static Action0 action0(@Nonnull
                      String expression,
                      @Nonnull
                      ScriptEngine engine,
                      @Nonnull
                      Map<String,Object> bindings)
        Returns a parameterless action which invokes the given script on the script engine.

        The syntax of the expression follows the generic lambda format used throughout this utility class:

        => expression1; expression;

        You may omit the => completely.

        Parameters:
        expression - the original lambda expression
        engine - the script engine to use
        bindings - the external resources the script might need
        Returns:
        the function

      • action0

        @Nonnull
public static Action0 action0(@Nonnull
                      String expression,
                      @Nonnull
                      ScriptEngine engine,
                      @Nonnull
                      Object... nameThenObject)
        Creates a parameterless action which executes the given script with the given script engine. In addition, you may specify extra bindings in the varargs parameters as [String(name), Object(value)] type, e.g., "ref1", 1, "ref2", 2.0.

        The syntax of the expression follows the generic lambda format used throughout this utility class:

        paramName => expression1; expression; return result;
        Parameters:
        expression - the lambda expression
        engine - the scripting engine to use
        nameThenObject - the String, Object, String, Object, ... sequence of name and value pairs.
        Returns:
        the function

        Type Parameters:

        Parameters:
        expression - the lambda expression
        engine - the engine to run the expression

      • getEngine

        @Nullable
public static ScriptEngine getEngine(@Nonnull
                              String name)
        Retrieve a script engine for the given name. This method is equivalent to new ScriptEngineManager().getEngineByName(name) call.
        Parameters:
        name - the script engine name. For javascript, you may use js.
        Returns:
        the script engine

        The syntax of the expression follows the generic lambda format used throughout this utility class:

        => expression1; expression; return result

        For zero parameters, you may omit the => completely.

        @Nonnull
public static <T,U,V> Func2<T,U,V> js2(@Nonnull
                               String expression)
        Creates a two parameter function which invokes the script engine with a given expression and returns its result.

        The syntax of the expression follows the generic lambda format used throughout this utility class:

        paramName1, paramName2 => expression1; expression; return result;
        Type Parameters:
        T - the result type of the function
        U - the first parameter type
        V - the second parameter type
        Parameters:
        expression - the lambda expression
        Returns:
        the function

      • script0

        @Nonnull
public static <T> Func0<T> script0(@Nonnull
                           String expression,
                           @Nonnull
                           ScriptEngine engine,
                           @Nonnull
                           Map<String,Object> bindings)
        Returns a parameterless function which invokes the given script on the script engine and retunrs its value.

        The syntax of the expression follows the generic lambda format used throughout this utility class:

        param1, param2 => expression1; expression; return result

        For zero parameters, you may omit the => completely.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the return type of the function
        Parameters:
        expression - the original lambda expression
        engine - the script engine to use
        bindings - the external resources the script might need
        Returns:
        the function

        @Nonnull
public static <T> Func0<T> script0(@Nonnull
                           String expression,
                           @Nonnull

                           @Nonnull
                           Object... nameThenObject)
        Creates a parameterless function which executes the given script as javascript. In addition, you may specify extra bindings in the varargs parameters as [String(name), Object(value)] type, e.g., "ref1", 1, "ref2", 2.0.

        The syntax of the expression follows the generic lambda format used throughout this utility class:

        paramName => expression1; expression; return result;
        Type Parameters:
        T - the result type
        Parameters:
        expression - the lambda expression

        @Nonnull
public static <T,U,V> Func2<T,U,V> script2(@Nonnull
                                   String expression,
                                   @Nonnull
                                   ScriptEngine engine,
                                   @Nonnull
                                   Object... nameThenObject)
        Creates a two parameter function which executes the given script as javascript. In addition, you may specify extra bindings in the varargs parameters as [String(name), Object(value)] type, e.g., "ref1", 1, "ref2", 2.0.

        The syntax of the expression follows the generic lambda format used throughout this utility class:

        paramName => expression1; expression; return result;
        Type Parameters:

        U - the first parameter type
        V - the second parameter type

        expression - the lambda expression
